messages.content:
You are DocIntel, a contract analysis AI. Extract structured information from contract clauses. Return valid JSON matching the provided schema.

Schema fields:
- document_type: NDA | MSA | SaaS | Employment | Lease | Other
- parties: [{name, role}]
- effective_date, expiration_date
- key_clauses: [{clause_type, text, page, risk_level, risk_reason}]
- obligations: [{party, obligation, deadline}]
- summary

Analyze this contract and extract key information:

MSA AGREEMENT

This MSA Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2022-06-06 (the "Effective Date") by and between Nelson-Lamb, a Kentucky corporation ("Nelson-Lamb" or "Party A"), and Martin-Stevens, a Missouri corporation ("Martin-Stevens" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, Nelson-Lamb desires to engage Martin-Stevens to provide certain services related to incentivize customized niches; and

WHEREAS, Martin-Stevens desires to provide such services subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Term and Renewal. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for an initial term of 1 year(s) (the "Initial Term"). Thereafter, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive 2-year periods (each a "Renewal Term") unless either party provides written notice of non-rene...

Section 2. Liability Cap. The maximum aggregate liability of either party arising out of or related to this Agreement shall not exceed the greater of (a) the amounts paid or payable under this Agreement during the twelve (12) months prior to the claim, or (b) $389,000. This limitation shall not apply to breach...

Section 3. Non-Competition. During the term of this Agreement and for a period of 12 months following its termination, Martin-Stevens agrees not to directly or indirectly engage in, own, manage, operate, or participate in any business that competes with Nelson-Lamb's core business of reinvent global info-media...

Analyze this contract and extract key information:

MSA AGREEMENT

This MSA Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2025-06-03 (the "Effective Date") by and between Kane-Pollard, a Connecticut corporation ("Kane-Pollard" or "Party A"), and Armstrong and Sons, a North Dakota corporation ("Armstrong and Sons" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, Kane-Pollard desires to engage Armstrong and Sons to provide certain services related to redefine ubiquitous synergies; and

WHEREAS, Armstrong and Sons desires to provide such services subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Intellectual Property Ownership. All Work Product created by Armstrong and Sons in connection with the Services shall be considered "work made for hire" as defined under the Copyright Act and shall be the sole and exclusive property of Kane-Pollard. To the extent any Work Product does not qualify as...

Section 2. Mutual Indemnification. Each party agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other party from any third-party claims arising from: (i) a material breach of representations or warranties; (ii) violation of applicable law; or (iii) gross negligence or willful misconduct. The indemnified party...

Analyze this contract and extract key information:

Other AGREEMENT

This Other Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2021-02-23 (the "Effective Date") by and between King-Wilson, a Oklahoma corporation ("King-Wilson" or "Party A"), and Hancock-Bryan, a Alabama corporation ("Hancock-Bryan" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, King-Wilson desires to engage Hancock-Bryan to provide certain services related to engage transparent infrastructures; and

WHEREAS, Hancock-Bryan desires to provide such services subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Confidentiality. Each party acknowledges that in connection with this Agreement it may receive Confidential Information of the other party. "Confidential Information" means any information disclosed by one party to the other, whether orally, in writing, or electronically, that is designated as confi...

Section 2. Liability Cap. The maximum aggregate liability of either party arising out of or related to this Agreement shall not exceed the greater of (a) the amounts paid or payable under this Agreement during the twelve (12) months prior to the claim, or (b) $127,000. This limitation shall not apply to breach...

Section 3. License Grant. King-Wilson grants to Hancock-Bryan a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use the Software during the term of this Agreement solely for Hancock-Bryan's internal business purposes. Hancock-Bryan shall not sublicense, modify, reverse engineer, or create derivative work...

Section 4. Term and Renewal. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for an initial term of 2 year(s) (the "Initial Term"). Thereafter, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive 2-year periods (each a "Renewal Term") unless either party provides written notice of non-rene...

Analyze this contract and extract key information:

Other AGREEMENT

This Other Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2022-04-15 (the "Effective Date") by and between Dominguez Inc, a Nevada corporation ("Dominguez Inc" or "Party A"), and Benson-Woods, a Massachusetts corporation ("Benson-Woods" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, Dominguez Inc desires to engage Benson-Woods to provide certain services related to generate global action-items; and

WHEREAS, Benson-Woods desires to provide such services subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Term and Renewal. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for an initial term of 1 year(s) (the "Initial Term"). Thereafter, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive 1-year periods (each a "Renewal Term") unless either party provides written notice of non-rene...

Section 2. Termination for Cause. Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other party: (a) materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within 15 days after receiving written notice thereof; (b) becomes insolvent or files for bankruptcy; or (c) cease...

Section 3. License Grant. Dominguez Inc grants to Benson-Woods a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use the Software during the term of this Agreement solely for Benson-Woods's internal business purposes. Benson-Woods shall not sublicense, modify, reverse engineer, or create derivative works...

Section 4. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Kansas, without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any legal action or proceeding arising under this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in K...

Section 5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. IN NO EVENT SHALL DOMINGUEZ INC BE LIABLE TO BENSON-WOODS FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, REGARDLESS OF THE CAUSE OF ACTION OR THE THEORY OF LIABILITY, EVEN IF DOMINGUEZ INC HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. THE T...

"Confidential Information" means any information disclosed by one party to the other, whether orally, in writing, or electronically, that is designated as confi...

Section 2. Payment Terms. Brown-Ramirez shall pay Porter-Andrade the fees set forth in the applicable Statement of Work within Net 30 days of receipt of a valid invoice. Late payments shall accrue interest at the rate of 1.0% per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less. All fees are exclu...

Section 3. Intellectual Property Ownership. All Work Product created by Brown-Ramirez in connection with the Services shall be considered "work made for hire" as defined under the Copyright Act and shall be the sole and exclusive property of Porter-Andrade. Employment AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2024-01-21 (the "Effective Date") by and between Patterson, Smith and Jones, a Nebraska corporation ("Patterson, Smith and Jones" or "Party A"), and Mckee, Gardner and Davenport, a Texas corporation ("Mckee, Gardner and Davenport" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, Patterson, Smith and Jones desires to engage Mckee, Gardner and Davenport to provide certain services related to cultivate interactive niches; and

Section 1. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of South Carolina, without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any legal action or proceeding arising under this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts loca...

Section 2. Termination for Convenience. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time, for any reason or no reason, upon 60 days' prior written notice to the other party. Upon such termination, Mckee, Gardner and Davenport shall pay Patterson, Smith and Jones for all services performed and expenses inc...

Section 3. Dispute Resolution. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall first be submitted to mediation in accordance with the mediation rules of the American Arbitration Association. If mediation fails to resolve the dispute within 45 days, either party may initiat...

Section 4. Indemnification. Patterson, Smith and Jones (the "Indemnifying Party") shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Mckee, Gardner and Davenport (the "Indemnified Party"), its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expen...
